instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1502: What is A1502? A1502 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2014, Late 2013, Early 2015 with EMC 2875, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-3476, 820-3536, 820-4924..
definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no power
threads.message:
Hi,

I have an <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A that has no fan spin, but has green light cpu gets hot, has usb activity, and consumes 550 mA on the bench PS.
It had some corrosion on <RESISTOR>R7179</RESISTOR>, and a lose track to the <CHIP>U7200</CHIP>, that i have made a jumper to.
I have 1v at <RESISTOR>R7119</RESISTOR>

What should i measure next? Can you help?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no power
threads.message:
Correction. It seams the the resistance replacement and the jumper solve the power on problem.
The computer already has power and starts up de OSX.
The problem seams to be some fan sensor, because the fan does'nt spin on normal use, but it spins on the diagnostics test.
What should i do?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no power
threads.message:
"the fan does'nt spin on normal use"
Absolutely normal, we specified this many times about 4924 board.
Fan spins only when the CPU gets really hot.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no power
